frameDefinitions: The Reader attends to a Text to process its information.
An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.
A Speaker conventionally uses a particular Term to refer to an Entity.

This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2).
A Reader visually examines a Text, typically in a linear order, to understand its content.
A Speaker interprets a written Text and speaks the contents, usually to an Addressee.
frameExamples: I <t>read</t> A Tale of Two Cities last night.
She <t>scattered</t> his ashes in the bay.
The pattern of conservation is similar to that found in C1_1, therefore we have <t>termed</t> this domain DC1 for divergent C1 domain.
The company is <t>raising</t> the final dividend from 4.34p to 4.57p, to boost the total by 5.3 percent to 6.36p.
I do think they <t>read</t> to them when they are little. INI
listRoleDefinitions: The one who examines a Text to understand it.
The entity that contains linguistic symbols.
When the reading event takes place.
Where the reading event takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> disperses or scatters the <fen>Individuals</fen>.
The <fen>Individuals</fen> are scattered by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An event or force that causes that <fen>Individuals</fen> to disperse.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are dispersed.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the dispersing event happens.
The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that is conventionally referred to by a <fen>Term</fen>.
The linguistic sign that is used for referring to a type of <fen>Entity</fen>.
The speaker or speech community that uses a <fen>Term</fen> to refer to a particular <fen>Entity</fen>.
The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).
The scale along which the <fen>Item</fen> ranges in value.
The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the value of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The one who examines a <fen>Text</fen> to understand it.
The entity that contains linguistic symbols.
The idea that an implicit <fen>Text</fen> or texts focuses on.
When the reading event takes place.
Where the reading event takes place.
The person or people to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> is directing the reading of the <fen>Text</fen>.
The person who reads the <fen>Text</fen> aloud.
The source from which the <fen>Speaker</fen> reads.
When the reading takes place.
The location at which the reading takes place.
listRoleExamples: Charlie often reads the newspaper <fex>at night</fex>.
Surprisingly, few of the students read much at all <fex>in the designated reading rooms</fex>.
Because of that shift, physicists call <fex>this effect</fex> the 'gravitational red shift.'
The French term this plant <fex>Petit Chêne</fex>, from the shape of the leaves.
<fex>Mathematicians</fex> call this subject 'arithmetic,' reserving the word 'algebra' for the more advanced aspects of the subject.
<fex>The rain</fex> increased the river's flow rate to an astonishing million gallons per second.
As a result, they raised prices <fex>in Peoria</fex>.
